title: Small abomination
data:
***Version [0.32](/0.32 "0.32")**: This article is up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of *Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup*.*

| small abomination x [![Small abomination.png](/images/b/b3/Small_abomination.png)](/File:Small_abomination.png) |                                                                                                                                                                         |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [HP](/Hit_points "Hit points")                                                                                  | 17-36                                                                                                                                                                   |
| [HD](/Hit_dice "Hit dice")                                                                                      | 6                                                                                                                                                                       |

| [Will](/Willpower "Willpower")                                                                                  | 40                                                                                                                                                                      |

| [Resistances](/Resistance "Resistance")                                                                         | [rPois+++](/Poison "Poison") [rDrown](/Asphyxiation "Asphyxiation") [rMiasma](/Miasma "Miasma") [rN+++](/Negative_energy "Negative energy") [rTorm](/Torment "Torment") |

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| - | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A hideous mass of body parts. Each varies in speed, strength, or resilience by the nature of whatever unfortunates were used to make it.***“No — it wasn't that way at all. It was everywhere — a gelatin — a slime yet it had shapes, a thousand shapes of horror beyond all memory. There were eyes — and a blemish. It was the pit — the maelstrom — the ultimate abomination. Carter, it was the unnamable!” -H.P. Lovecraft, \_The Unnamable\_. 1925. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [3 Alternate Tiles](#Alternate_Tiles)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Small abominations** are mindless, [demonic](/Demonic "Demonic"), [undead](/Undead "Undead") horrors that stalk [the Abyss](/The_Abyss "The Abyss"). They spawn with [haste](/Haste "Haste"), [might](/Might "Might"), or [regeneration](/Regeneration "Regeneration") as a permanent buff. They are much less dangerous than [large abominations](/Large_abomination "Large abomination"), but can still be pests, especially due to their high speed.

## Tips & Tricks

- Though these are much weaker than the [big version](/Large_abomination "Large abomination"), they are faster. This makes running from them in the Abyss a challenge, and you generally don't want to stand and fight there.
- They can usually be one-shot by [Dispel Undead](/Dispel_Undead "Dispel Undead").

## Alternate Tiles

Being haphazard collections of random body parts, small abominations can take multiple forms:

[![Abomination small.png](/images/7/7d/Abomination_small.png)](/File:Abomination_small.png) [![Abomination small1.png](/images/6/63/Abomination_small1.png)](/File:Abomination_small1.png) [![Abomination small2.png](/images/5/5b/Abomination_small2.png)](/File:Abomination_small2.png)

## History

- Prior to [0.32](/0.32 "0.32"), small abominations had randomized attributes instead of spawning with a permanent buff. Also, they did not regenerate.
- Prior to [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), small abominations had randomized speed (7-15). They also gained several new tiles in this version.
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), small abominations could heal by fusing with [crawling corpses](/Crawling_corpse "Crawling corpse") and [macabre masses](/Macabre_mass "Macabre mass"). Also, monsters could cast [Twisted Resurrection](/Twisted_Resurrection "Twisted Resurrection"), allowing them to create small abominations.
- Prior to [0.16](/0.16 "0.16"), players could also cast Twisted Resurrection.
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), abominations could heal naturally.
- Prior to [0.12](/0.12 "0.12"), you could read a [scroll of unholy creation](/Scroll_of_unholy_creation "Scroll of unholy creation") to get a permanent friendly abomination.
html:
Small abomination

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.32: This article is up to date for the latest stable release of Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup.
small abomination x 
HP 17-36
HD 6
XP 164
Speed 12
AC 6
EV 9
Will 40
Attack1 17 (hit: plain)


Resistances rPois+++
rDrown
rMiasma
rN+++
rTorm
Vulnerabilities Holy
Silver
Habitat Land
Intelligence Brainless
Uses Uses nothing
Holiness Undead
Size Large
Type small abomination, small abomination
Flags Evil
Unbreathing
A hideous mass of body parts. Each varies in speed, strength, or resilience by the nature of whatever unfortunates were used to make it.

“No — it wasn't that way at all. It was everywhere — a gelatin — a slime yet it had shapes, a thousand shapes of horror beyond all memory. There were eyes — and a blemish. It was the pit — the maelstrom — the ultimate abomination. Carter, it was the unnamable!”
-H.P. Lovecraft, _The Unnamable_. 1925.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Tips & Tricks
  • 3 Alternate Tiles
  • 4 History

Useful Info

Small abominations are mindless, demonic, undead horrors that stalk the Abyss. They spawn with haste, might, or regeneration as a permanent buff. They are much less dangerous than large abominations, but can still be pests, especially due to their high speed.

Tips & Tricks

  • Though these are much weaker than the big version, they are faster. This makes running from them in the Abyss a challenge, and you generally don't want to stand and fight there.
  • They can usually be one-shot by Dispel Undead.

Alternate Tiles

Being haphazard collections of random body parts, small abominations can take multiple forms:

History

  • Prior to 0.32, small abominations had randomized attributes instead of spawning with a permanent buff. Also, they did not regenerate.
  • Prior to 0.31, small abominations had randomized speed (7-15). They also gained several new tiles in this version.
  • Prior to 0.27, small abominations could heal by fusing with crawling corpses and macabre masses. Also, monsters could cast Twisted Resurrection, allowing them to create small abominations.
  • Prior to 0.16, players could also cast Twisted Resurrection.
  • Prior to 0.14, abominations could heal naturally.
  • Prior to 0.12, you could read a scroll of unholy creation to get a permanent friendly abomination.
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Small_abomination&oldid=81066"

rawPage:
{{version032}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Small abominations''' are mindless, [[demonic]], [[undead]] horrors that stalk [[the Abyss]]. They spawn with [[haste]], [[might]], or [[regeneration]] as a permanent buff. They are much less dangerous than [[large abomination]]s, but can still be pests, especially due to their high speed.

==Tips & Tricks==
*Though these are much weaker than the [[large abomination|big version]], they are faster. This makes running from them in the Abyss a challenge, and you generally don't want to stand and fight there.
*They can usually be one-shot by [[Dispel Undead]].

==Alternate Tiles==
Being haphazard collections of random body parts, small abominations can take multiple forms:

[[Image:Abomination small.png]] [[Image:Abomination small1.png]]  [[Image:Abomination small2.png]]

==History==
*Prior to [[0.32]], small abominations had randomized attributes instead of spawning with a permanent buff. Also, they did not regenerate.
*Prior to [[0.31]], small abominations had randomized speed (7-15). They also gained several new tiles in this version.
*Prior to [[0.27]], small abominations could heal by fusing with [[crawling corpse]]s and [[macabre mass]]es. Also, monsters could cast [[Twisted Resurrection]], allowing them to create small abominations.
*Prior to [[0.16]], players could also cast Twisted Resurrection.
*Prior to [[0.14]], abominations could heal naturally.
*Prior to [[0.12]], you could read a [[scroll of unholy creation]] to get a permanent friendly abomination.
